trial_identification.studytitle: What is the frequency of central venous catheter-related venous thrombosis in children?
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Frequency of and risk factors for central venous catheter-related venous thrombosis in children.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions:
Observational study.
The primary outcome of the study is the frequency of central venous catheter-related venous thrombosis in children receiving central venous catheters at Astrid Lindgrens Children´s Hospital. All children receiving central venous catheters at Astrid Lindgrens Children´s Hospital will be included in the study.
Blood sampling for coagulation tests will be obtained at the insertion and extraction of the central venous catheter (CVC). Patients will be followed for clinical signs of CVC-related venous thrombosis as long as the central venous catheter is in place. Ultrasonography will be used to detect asymptomatic thrombosis at the time of CVC removal.
Patients will be followed until hospital discharge. Patients that develop CVC-related thrombosis will be followed until the end of treatment.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Frequency of central venous catheter-related venous thrombosis assessed by ultrasonography.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: PICU length of stay, data from medical records.
Hospital length of stay, data from medical records.
Time on mechanical ventilation, data from medical records.
In-hospital mortality, data from medical records.
Short term (in-hospital) complications of venous thrombosis, data from medical records.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients with a central venous catheter
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: - No informed consent. - Previous thrombosis in the CVC-vein. - Death is deemed imminent and inevitable. - CVC inserted during ECMO-treatment

trial_design.statisticalmethods: Non-parametric statistics will be used to investigate differences between patients with and without CVC-related venous thrombosis. Multivariate analysis will be used to identify risk factors for venous thrombosis. he number of participants was chosen based on the expected number of patients meeting inclusion criteria during 12 months in Astrid Lindgren´s Children Hospital.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study investigates the frequency of central venous catheter-related venous thrombosis in children. Further, we want to describe risk factors for the development of central venous catheter-related venous thrombosis in children and short term complications of thrombosis.
